name: Indus Hospital
mission:
Friends of Indus Hospital, Inc (FOIH) is a US-based 501(c)(3) registered charity. We strive to create awareness about the healthcare needs of underprivileged patients and raise funds to provide them with equitable care. By supporting healthcare efforts in Pakistan, FOIH is helping to ensure that vulnerable individuals have access to the healthcare they need, regardless of financial or other barriers.
Through annual fundraising initiatives, community events, and awareness drives, we seek to mobilize a strong tradition of community giving and a shared commitment to changing the paradigm of healthcare delivery in Pakistan.
FOIH is an initiative taken by Americans of Pakistani origin expatriates and supported by a wider community across the USA.
All donations given to FOIH are eligible for tax deduction under US law.
theoryOfChange: By providing free, high-quality healthcare through a network of hospitals, the organization removes financial barriers to medical treatment, leading to improved health outcomes for the underserved in Pakistan.
zakatClaimEvidence: Fulfill your Islamic obligation of Zakat with Friends of Indus Hospital. Donate Now. Friends of Indus Hospital, Inc (FOIH) is a US-based 501(c) (3) registered charity. Your Zakat contributes directly to sustaining free, quality healthcare as 70% of patients at Indus Hospital & Health Network are Zakat-Eligible. Friends of Indus Hospital collects Zakat on behalf of patients treated at Indus Hospital & Health Network. By supporting healthcare initiatives like those at Indus Hospital, Zakat donors contribute to the healing and preservation of life, fulfilling a noble Islamic obligation. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQG4y1BRIkBgZlJXTzpd25CICuFllZpKE-58B-C4KnDAPjyhjFrL2VAEdM9U1XhWOkosuiCmBXllT9CUoEUmAi4jGDxdKOC2J6_dmy5OGIs=)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 41/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build reserves toward your board-approved target range (often 3-12 months), adjusted for revenue volatility and obligations.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

score_details.score_summary: Friends of Indus Hospital Inc shows strong alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Fulfill your Islamic obligation of Zakat with Friends of Indus Hospital. Donate Now. Friends of Indus Hospital, Inc (FOIH) is a US-based 501(c) (3) registered charity. Your Zakat contributes directly to sustaining free, quality healthcare as 70% of patients at Indus Hospital & Health Network are Zakat-Eligible. Friends of Indus Hospital collects Zakat on behalf of patients treated at Indus Hospital & Health Network. By supporting healthcare initiatives like those at Indus Hospital, Zakat donors contribute to the healing and preservation of life, fulfilling a noble Islamic obligation. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQG4y1BRIkBgZlJXTzpd25CICuFllZpKE-58B-C4KnDAPjyhjFrL2VAEdM9U1XhWOkosuiCmBXllT9CUoEUmAi4jGDxdKOC2J6_dmy5OGIs=)

all_citations.claim: Friends of Indus Hospital Inc holds a 95.75/100 score, with a fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised and 1.8 months of working capital.
The organization offers Zakat-eligible donation options for its healthcare programs.
The charity reported total revenue of $14,742,480 and a program expense ratio of 86.8% for its prosthetic, neonatal, and safe birth programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a high overall standing due to its exceptional financial efficiency and direct impact on critical healthcare needs in Pakistan, though its working capital reserves are relatively lean.
areas_for_improvement: Limited liquidity with working capital covering only 1.8 months of operations [1].
High dependence on international program implementation which requires ongoing oversight [3].

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is very high for humanitarian-focused donors, particularly within the Muslim community, as the organization provides a transparent, Zakat-eligible pathway to support one of Pakistan's most respected health networks [1][2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates high impact through direct service delivery, maintaining an 86.8% program expense ratio and a total revenue of $14,742,480 to fund life-saving treatments [1][3]. Its focus on specialized areas like neonatal care and prosthetics addresses urgent gaps in the Pakistani healthcare system [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Friends of Indus Hospital Inc supports the delivery of free, high-quality healthcare to underserved populations in Pakistan through the Indus Hospital and Health Network.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 86.8%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach medical services [3].
Excellent fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.11 to raise every $1 [1].
Strong third-party validation with a Charity Navigator score of 95.75/100 [1].
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in the United States, Friends of Indus Hospital Inc is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit dedicated to funding specialized medical programs including prosthetic limbs, neonatal care, and safe birth initiatives [1][3]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting humanitarian medical relief [2].
